summary: U.S. airports collectively received $14 billion annually (on average) for infrastructure projects between fiscal years 2013-2017. Their three largest funding sources are: Funding from federal Airport Improvement Program grants Revenue from passenger fees Airport-generated revenue—e.g., concessions However, airport officials said that these combined funds may not be enough to cover the costs of their planned infrastructure projects.
